page.title: 12 Yardley Hastings News
page.content: {Snippets from the 1984 News Sheet} Derek and Bara Gill have handed the Rose and Crown pub over to Mr and Mrs Louis so that they could have a well earned retirement. Ken and Margret Higginson have moved from Skegness to take over the Red Lion pub. Yardley Hastings will soon become a conservation area, although many villagers feel that it has come 20yrs. to late The country fair organised by the Yardley Hastings Society at Castle Ashby House attracted 18,000 people This year the Rev. Davies retired and a cheque for 315 pounds was presented to him along with a water painting of the church and a glass goblet. The Greenyard Development of new executive housing is now complete and fully occupied
